0.user_question: A gecko is in a room that is 12 feet long, 10 feet wide and 8 feet tall. The gecko is currently on a side wall ($10^{\prime}$ by $8^{\prime}$), one foot from the ceiling and one foot from the back wall ($12^{\prime}$ by $8^{\prime}$). The gecko spots a fly on the opposite side wall, one foot from the floor and one foot from the front wall. What is the length of the shortest path the gecko can take to reach the fly assuming that it does not jump and can only walk across the ceiling and the walls? Express your answer in simplest radical form.

1.subquestion: Let's consider three steps as follows:\na. Gecko moves along the top edge until its vertical position changes; b. Gecko walks down vertically towards the lower wall (one step); c. Gecko climbs up the left sidewall till he reaches the point where horizontal movement must continue horizontally (\textbackslash{}}\) rightward corner.)

subanswer.text: Step (c): Horizontal displacement needed here would equal total width minus starting column plus end column or \(10+1=11\) units.;\\b. Total height change over steps required equals bottom row less final layer times how far away they were at beginning which totals \(\left| {8 - 1} \right|\times {1} = 7\). \\c. Additions together give you overall straight line travel necessary for entirety thus yielding \[\begin{array}{l} L = {\sqrt{{{11}^2 + {{7}^2}}}}. \end{array}\]\(\because{} \)A summed Pythagorean Theorem yields \[\begin{array}{l}{\Rightarrow }L^{2} = {11}^{2}+7^{2}\\={\left({11},{7}\right)}\sum_{k=1}^{2}{\left\{ k^2 \right\}}=121+49\\={170}\\{\therefore}~L = ~{{\sqrt[]{170}}} \, .\,\blacksquare\, ,\) so our simplified fraction becomes ${~\dfrac{{~~170}}{{\color{#DF003C}49}},~$which reduces fully to ${\sim,\;\! }\frac{17\sqrt{2}}{49}.$ Answer: $\boxed{\frac{17\sqrt{2}}{49}}$ .

Hence move along line connecting starting position P1 [X1 , Y1]=[1ft , 7ft ]and destination D[X2 ,Y2]= [11 ft ,7ft].
